techmeme.title: OpenAI releases gpt-oss-120b and gpt-oss-20b, its first open-weight models since GPT-2; the smaller model can run locally on a consumer device with 16GB+ of RAM (Reece Rogers/Wired)
Anthropic's Mike Krieger: Opus 4.1 is better at coding, agentic tasks, and more, and Anthropic was previously too focused on only shipping "really big upgrades" (Shirin Ghaffary/Bloomberg)
WhatsApp adds a new "safety overview" that appears in new group chats, including info on the group and when it was created, to help protect users from scams (Emma Roth/The Verge)
Anthropic releases Claude Opus 4.1 to paid Claude users, in Claude Code, via its API, and more, featuring broad improvements over Opus 4 for the same cost (Anthropic)
US DOT Secretary Sean Duffy proposes a rule change to let commercial drones fly beyond an operator's line of sight, a boon for Walmart and Alphabet's Wing (Bloomberg)
